Description: Rim sherd (mended from three fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim (mostly lost), glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower and possibly rosette in added white outline; exterior: part of paired hook maeander frieze between bands at rim; below, part of pendant roundel as filling ornament; surface mostly worn.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by World Museum, Liverpool. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Only the largest of the three joining fragments is published in Lemos 1991.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 265, no. 580, pl. 73) (Incorrectly labelled as 56,21,529)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0608) (phase 2)
